intro: Bartsia acuminata, commonly known as the acuteleaf bartsia, is a small herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. Bartsia acuminata is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils, thanks to its semi-parasitic nature.
